explainability.path_to_improvement: Document how explanations are provided to users affected by AI decisions.

external_accountability.findings: Sources describe documented external accountability practices in 1 source(s). Additional documentation references related practices.
external_accountability.path_to_improvement: Publish third-party audit results, certifications, or regulatory compliance documentation.

relevant_sources.summary: This third-party analysis of Ross Stores' AI integration documents practices supporting **external_accountability, fairness, governance, and transparency**. The report details Ross Stores' commitment to transparency through open communication about AI use and ethical concerns, and their efforts to ensure fairness by employing diverse datasets, regular audits, and collaboration with external experts. Evidence of governance is found in their implementation of feedback loops for AI refinement, workforce training programs, and participation in industry consortiums for ethical AI standards.
relevant_sources.title: Ross Stores AI Integration, Sustainability, and Innovation

fairness.findings: Efforts to ensure fairness are described through the employment of diverse datasets and regular audits. Additionally, collaboration with external experts is referenced as part of these fairness efforts.
fairness.path_to_improvement: Publish bias testing results, outcome monitoring, or vendor fairness certifications.

Evidence of governance is found in their implementation of feedback loops for AI refinement, workforce training programs, and participation in industry consortiums for ethical AI standards.
relevant_sources.title: Ross Stores AI Integration, Sustainability, and Innovation

governance.findings: Governance practices are referenced, including the implementation of feedback loops for AI refinement and workforce training programs. Participation in industry consortiums for ethical AI standards is also noted.
governance.path_to_improvement: Name an AI governance body with defined mandate covering all AI use.

The report details Ross Stores' commitment to transparency through open communication about AI use and ethical concerns, and their efforts to ensure fairness by employing diverse datasets, regular audits, and collaboration with external experts. Evidence of governance is found in their implementation of feedback loops for AI refinement, workforce training programs, and participation in industry consortiums for ethical AI standards.

oversight.path_to_improvement: Document human review processes for AI-assisted decisions (built or vendor AI).

privacy.path_to_improvement: Document data protection practices for AI systems, including vendor AI data handling.

transparency.findings: Ross Stores' commitment to transparency is documented through open communication regarding AI use. This commitment also extends to open communication about ethical concerns related to AI.
transparency.path_to_improvement: Publish detailed documentation (model cards, system specs) for AI systems deployed.

relevant_sources.summary: This third-party analysis of Ross Stores' AI integration documents practices supporting **external_accountability, fairness, governance, and transparency**. The report details Ross Stores' commitment to transparency through open communication about AI use and ethical concerns, and their efforts to ensure fairness by employing diverse datasets, regular audits, and collaboration with external experts. Evidence of governance is found in their implementation of feedback loops for AI refinement, workforce training programs, and participation in industry consortiums for ethical AI standards.
relevant_sources.title: Ross Stores AI Integration, Sustainability, and Innovation

summary.overall_findings: Ross Stores' public disclosures address transparency and fairness, two of the four responsible AI pillars with documented evidence. Materials describe efforts to ensure fairness by employing diverse datasets and regular audits, alongside a commitment to transparency through open communication about AI use. Governance materials reference the implementation of feedback loops for AI refinement, and external accountability practices are also documented. No qualifying public evidence was found for explainability, oversight, and 1 additional pillar, based on a review of 1 publicly available source.
